newsitem.title: TUNISIA: Tunisian unemployment rate drops slightly in 1995.
newsitem.headline: Tunisian unemployment rate drops slightly in 1995.

text.p: Tunisia's unemployment rate dropped to 15.5 percent in 1995 from 15.8 percent in 1994, a Central Bank report said.

The report said that despite the effect of drought on employment in the agriculture sector, 61,000 jobs were created in 1995, making it possible to cover over 95 percent of the additional demand for employment that year.
The total workforce in 1995 was 376,000, it added.

Manufacturing industries created 17,000 jobs in 1995, against 16,000 in 1994, while services, excluding tourism, created 21,500 jobs. New positions in government offices increased to 10,500 from 9,500, and new jobs in tourism totalled 3,500, the report said.
